website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a comprehensive natural disaster kit that includes everything from the basics to items you may never have considered, this is the one to get.
pros: A well-stocked kit that comes with food, tools, first aid items, hygiene products, and more
Four emergency blankets, 2 LED lanterns, and a portable stove are welcomed additions
Water that comes with it has a 5-year shelf life
cons: Backpack doesn't have a lot of room for extras, but it already comes with the majority of disaster essentials

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Complete Survival Bag
customer_reviews.text: This unit contains a lot of great stuff, all high-quality and well packed. The weight comes mostly from the water packs, and there is a filter system to supplement. Mark the expiration date of the water on the outside so you can replace it in five years. Everything else is shelf stable for 30 or so years. Some room for additional equipment. I recommend: - Loose, extra batteries - Crank Radio/Phone Charger - Matches/Lighters... Yes, you can use the flint, but why would you want to work that hard? Get some cheap Bics) - Small bottle of high-quality vodka/rum/whisky. Just, you know, in case.
customer_reviews.author: Garth Howard

customer_reviews.title: Food and Water shelf life are both 5 years,
customer_reviews.text: MAJOR CORRECTION: I was not happy to find that this info contained here is incorrect after making my purchase. Documentation that came with product indicated food has a 5 year shelf life, NOT 30 years as indicated within Customer's Questions and Answers. My documentation did not indicate a shelf life for the water so I googled the suppliers website and verified that water and food both have 5 year shelf life. I guess the trick is not to count on information contained in customer's questions and answers.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A Marler

customer_reviews.title: a good bag, and a really good knife
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased other survival bags to dissect and reassemble with my own spin, this package is a cut above the rest. Quality supplies, a good bag, and a really good knife.
customer_reviews.author: DrGunzo

customer_reviews.title: They thought of everything that was important.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I was concerned about the price but decided to order based on what was described to be included and the previous reviews. I was not disappointed. The creators of this product really thought this through and each of the items included are good quality. You will need some AAA and AA batteries. I do like that the back pack is very sturdy and has a little extra space to add additional items specific to your family's individual needs. I added a large ziplock bag of dog food and two collapsible dog dishes. Also added a few of my own fuel bricks. I most definitely would recommend and already have.
customer_reviews.author: K.L.

customer_reviews.title: High-quality, durable, impressive
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed! We bought a number of these (for vehicles, house, etc.) and I just finished a full inventory of four 2-person kits. Every single one was fully stocked, every item I tested worked, and everything felt durable, lightweight, and well-constructed - including the backpack and other containers! My only issue with this kit is the first aid kit - it's very, very basic. I don't feel comfortable assuming that an emergency/evacuation situation will be resolvable with a few bandaids and some antibiotic ointment. I'll definitely be adding more serious first aid supplies!
customer_reviews.author: D. D.

customer_reviews.title: Water leaked everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: My backpack came soaking wet! The waters in the lower back of the bag broke open during transport I assume because when I opened my package the bag was moist and full of condensation so I unpacked everything and the bottom was soaked and all the water leaked out. And for a survival kit it should come with everything for $300 bucks and there’s no batteries for my led lanterns...that’s not helpful
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Davis

customer_reviews.title: Quality items and good selection, but my water boxes leaked during shipment
customer_reviews.text: Overall good products and high quality items. I feel better prepared. My water boxes leaked though. I would like to be contacted for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Good kit but missing items???
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to order and receive Sustain Supply Co. Essential bag. There are so many survival products out there and this bag seemed to have all the essentials. I had donated all my supplies in recent natural disasters so I was looking to replenish and gain a central place to store them. This bag seemed perfect. I wish it came with a basic wind up charger/radio but otherwise it is good. My reason for 2 stars is not everything was in the pack. Upon arrival the MoraKniv Companion knife was missing so it's a huge drawback for me when a company advertises something and doesn't fully deliver so for that I can not recommend. :(
customer_reviews.author: Miles Ichigo

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I love how compact the kit is, the knife looks very durable and it’s nice to have water and a water filtration device included. Everything arrived undamaged
customer_reviews.author: Justess

customer_reviews.title: My Mom and Dad are the type of people who like to prepare
customer_reviews.text: Quality and value are important to me and this kit delivers. My Mom and Dad are the type of people who like to prepare, but I was always late to the party. Now, I can tell them I am good to go. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Wise Company or Mountain House ..
customer_reviews.text: Picture shown is not the same as the product description. For example, the photos show Wise Company emergency food but the product description says Mountain House.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Sustain Survival Straw
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of this and both bags were missing the sustain survival straw, also the water has en expiration date of 2024 and it should be 2025
customer_reviews.author: Nilza R.

customer_reviews.title: I'll sleep better at night knowing we have this.
customer_reviews.text: Very good initial quality - I've inspected the contents, and nothing appears cheap, flimsy, or broken. I hesitated to buy this because of the expense, but I figured it's worth spending more to have a well-made bug-out bag on hand "just in case" a disaster occurs. One of these days, I'll collect the other survival gear we've accumulated and make an additional bag or two for friends/neighbors. Until then, having this thoughtfully prepared and high-quality pre-made kit will help me rest easier at night.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S

customer_reviews.title: Good Emergency Kit to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: As a new resident of Florida, I researched recommendations for emergencies (you know, those storms they give names to in the summer). Anyway, Sustain's Premium Kit contains many of the items that the proverbial "they" recommend to have on hand in cases of power outages or other nasty weather events. I am very pleased with the apparent quality of the products included in the kit. The backpack is a sturdy construction and is able to hold all of the included supplies, plus a bit more room for other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Morgan

customer_reviews.title: ... never have to use this but I feel much better owning it
customer_reviews.text: I really hope I never have to use this but I feel much better owning it. It was well organized and comes with an inventory list. There is room in the bag (which appears to be durable) to add more. I added an additional flash light and baby food.
customer_reviews.author: ananda

customer_reviews.title: I might have spent more buying items separately but I would have bought better quality. For now
customer_reviews.text: Pack came missing eating utensils and whistles. Not sure it's worth the price, I might have spent more buying items separately but I would have bought better quality. For now, it's better than nothing, I can build on it. Having the food and water supplies is important but I am irritated that there were items missing form the order.
customer_reviews.author: F. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Cardboard Water Container destroyed
customer_reviews.text: The contents of the pack and the pack itself are awesome. However, the cardboard water container was damaged at some point and leaked into the entire contents of the pack. The pack was moldy when it arrived as well as all of the contents. It's all garbage now.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The first time I went to retrieve items, the zipper fell apart. I'm terribly disappointed. This is why I give it a 1 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with this Premium Emergency Survival Bag. Way over priced for the items that are included in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice starter survival kit. I was pleasantly surprised at the good quality of the back pack. Everything fits in it without effort and it wears easily. I always thought I would put together a kit of my own but I doubt if I could have matched the price, plus I never got around to doing it. I might add a few items later, as there seems to be plenty of room in the pack. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Question about these tybes
customer_reviews.text: Everything came exactly how t was described. The only thing was one of the food packets was ripped. Also was wondering what these are for? Thanks in advance for any information. ...
customer_reviews.author: Al Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was packed nicely and organized well into the backpack. No spills, leaks or breaks in the perishable items. Only wish batteries for flashlight and lamp were included, but all in all, very satisfied with the products. - Lamp (4 AA batteries) - Flashlight (4 AAA batteries)
customer_reviews.author: Juan Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Great Survival Kit!
customer_reviews.text: I went looking for a kit to have on hand for hurricane season in Florida and chose this one because of the variety of items I could get in one bundle. I'm very happy with the quality of the backpack and items inside, everything is top notch. The bag has heavy duty zippers and plenty of space to unpack and easily repack the contents as needed. I definitely recommend this kit to anyone who likes to be prepared for anything.
customer_reviews.author: D&K Enterprise

customer_reviews.title: All in one bag, great product.
customer_reviews.text: Picked me up this bag after reviewing others online and in Amazon. Needed a bag for a family of four. Overall, great bag but feel the flashlights and lanterns are cheaply made (made in China). All the other products seem well made, to include the back pack (sturdy, although the zipper fabric came apart at the waist out the box but zipped back up together). Wish there was more food variety and feel it should’ve came with tents for what you pay for. Overall, great first time bag and would purchase again (shipping was fast too, came early!)
customer_reviews.author: E.Galvez

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: One of the more important items, the sawyer water filter was swapped out for 4 sustain survival straws. I use sawyer water filters and I trust them. I would like to have received what I ordered not a bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Wild tea lover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit! I was hesitant to spend this much money on an emergency kit, but figured it would be worth it if we ever needed to use it. The backpack is quite heavy (I purchased the 4 person kit), but that’s mostly due to the food and water supply, and I was happy to see that the backpack itself is of very high quality and will hold up with all the supplies inside. Everything included is legitimate survival-type items...nothing flimsy or cheap. Great bag I will recommend to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Keysor

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: A couple of the zippers were broken. For the price, I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John Dellinger

customer_reviews.title: The video is incorrect for the contents of this bag
customer_reviews.text: The bag is exactly as pictured which means the video is not correct for this particular product. Still mostly happy with the set up although the lantern doesn’t work after putting in brand new batteries (since it doesn’t come with them.) We’ll see what the seller says once I reach out to them. It’ll do for what we need but we were hoping for the packets of water and the quality brand water filter described in the video.
customer_reviews.author: indy

customer_reviews.title: Cadellac of Prep Packs
customer_reviews.text: wanted to update my hurricane prep and decided to give this a try as something I could store and forget until it happens. This is a pretty impressive pack and there are youtube vidoes out there dissecting it. This is the Cadillac of disaster kits. You can do more with less but this has top of the line freeze dried food, and a huge selection of tools and lights. Great kit, would recommend. Wish there was a six person one as I'm weird and have four kids, but otherwise this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. It has everything we need, and more. Just in time for Irma
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Blogg

customer_reviews.title: Great Start!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this survival bag because someone recommended it. It has some really good and sturdy things. I was upset because we were missing some items like the whistles. So when we called they had to send us a whole new bag because of it. The second bag also came without the whistles. Just had to buy a couple more items to add, including a whistle
customer_reviews.author: alice

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind packaged in a well-constructed bag!
customer_reviews.text: I am one of those shoppers who depends on the customer ratings/feedback and you guys did not disappoint. This is a HIGH-QUALITY item that I'm happy I purchase. As a First Responder in New Orleans, I now have a little piece of mind knowing that I have a premium emergency survival bag to get me through the 1st 72 hours. The bag is well constructed and neatly packed. I will recommend this to my fellow deputies.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Smith

customer_reviews.title: MOST items there, FOOD WAS not in the correct amount.  ADD BATTERIES
customer_reviews.text: Good items, about half of what I need. Echoing others: Pack is a bit thin and the zippers not very strong, but it will work, just be mindful of it. There was NOT the promised food for 72 hours, instead, only four meals included TOTAL. I will be emailing the company. Add batteries for your lights AND that first aid kit is NOT enough stuff. I will be shoring that up myself. Added a tent and will add a few other items as well from a Bug out Bag Checklist. Otherwise, all was included.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jackson

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice and sturdy bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice and sturdy bag. It is sectioned that allows for better divisions and storage. The supplies in the bag are nice but I also have a separate first aid kit that I had before. The thing I don't like is I wish there was more or different food. That is a concern. The water is also a concern. I am going to purchase a water purifier straw that purifies questionable water. I feel this is a good choice for a good and safe water supply.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: This is the sixth one I have bought.
customer_reviews.text: The house is well supplied with emergancy supplies. Needed something for the cars incase we were away from home. These will supply one person for two weeks, two people for one week or four people for three days. Everything you need in on bag, put into the trunk of the car. So bought two, one for each of my cars, and then four more for gifts for friends. Yes they are changing up a few things as one would expect. Wise, instead of Mountain House and a different type of water container/ supplier. But as they say, better to have and not need, then need and not have. This is an easy way to prepare for an emergancy.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: This is a great comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a large Earthquake, I had made a similar but not exact, I did not have extra of all of this to just keep in a "go bag" and this one is better! Its a great comfort knowing that I have good quality survival gear. Everything is top of the line! If you are living in a remote place, going on a long distance road trip, or just have a kid going away for college this is a great idea to just have in the car. There is also extra room in the bag to add some clothes and personal things. Most of this stuff all fits in the front pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Conley

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT Missing Items
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check EVERYTHING that is supposed to come in your bag. I purchased 2 backpacks that are for 4 people and in each backpack I am missing one blanket and the 4 whistle's in each bag.
customer_reviews.author: chom

customer_reviews.title: Good start for an emergency kit, but double-check that everything’s there
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent kit. The backpack seems sturdy, no zipper problems like another reviewer mentioned. And what’s included is high quality. But here’s what we’ll need to supplement it with: Additional water (only 4 liter containers were included, not 48 Datrex pouches, and not enough for 4 people for 3 days) Additional food (24 servings isn’t enough for 4 people for 3 days) Whistles (our kit was missing the whistles, except for the built-in one on the backpack buckle) Batteries for the lanterns and flashlights (not included) Sterno cans for the stove (which is just a pot on a stand) It’s a good place to start, but don’t assume this kit is 100% ready-to-go for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Parsons Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy backpack. I live in California and have always wanted to be prepared. I feel good knowing that I have the basic supplies with this kit. I take it with me to work in my trunk and bring it in at night. The backpack is comfortable to carry, and there is room inside to put other items. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Missing the 2 emergency whistles; otherwise, good product. I would appreciate it if my whistles were sent out to me.
customer_reviews.author: JMSP

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Overall this idea is a good one problem is came with missing items. 4 things missing reported it several days ago hoping theyd make good on it and send out missing stuff but never heard back. Pricey for what you get but again would be ok with this if all products came. My suggestion but your own pack and items that way cheaper and you can get what you want
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not what i saw in their video, i feel cheated.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that this is ofcourse better than nothing, it does cover some back things just was expecting better things for the money i payed. I feel like i got cheated because i saw their youtube video and right away got the bag, they took out items and changed alot of stuff. Just to name a few. The food in the bag is not what is shown, is not the mountain house brand its a cheaper readywise. The lighting seems verry cheaply made and there is no water filter
customer_reviews.author: edwin perez

customer_reviews.title: I don't feel like this is worth 200 dollars
customer_reviews.text: I don't feel like this is worth 200 dollars. I must say that the packages exists, but the items are difficult to find in the bag. The bag looks bigger than the actual size you get.
customer_reviews.author: Shreyas

customer_reviews.title: Just do it for insurance
customer_reviews.text: Adding cellphone backup power battery, dust masks, garbage bags, and matches, duct tape, toilet paper. I could have assembled my own kit from FEMA lists but this gave me a good push in right direction
customer_reviews.author: kaytee

customer_reviews.title: Quality contents and well thought out emergency go bag.
customer_reviews.text: All items included are nice quality. Beginning with a sturdy and attractive carrying bag, the content is well thought out and includes items that cover basic needs. Among other items, this includes light sticks and a nice quality LED lantern., water, food, a knife and blankets for warmth. This was exactly what wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ford

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. The items are good quality. I have added almost 10 more pounds of item to make this almost a 5 day bag for 2 people and there ia still room for more. The bag os very impressive and I like the way it unzips and has really cool compartments and room for to stuff as well as plenty of straps to attach more stuff
customer_reviews.author: Josh fowler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great bag I added a solar emergency hand-crank radio, wish it came with a few more things for the price. Have received compliments from emergency personnel. Probably a good thing to have if you live in an urban environment where they're burning down everything and you're not sure if you walk out in the street you'll be killed.
customer_reviews.author: brandon123

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you got all the items
customer_reviews.text: Check to make sure you got everything some items were missing. Check the expiration dates of the food and water. I added a crank radio flash night, AA batteries for the lantern, and matches. I put the pack on to make sure I could wear it comfortable. Be safe and take care world!
customer_reviews.author: KiiNani

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Preparations
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. The total package. Thank you to Amazon, the manufacturer and US Postal Service for getting this product to my family so rapidly. Ordered on Sunday evening and received Tuesday morning. Hurricane preparation as Florence is heading towards my location in the Lowcountry of South Carolina. Just in time! Peace of mind now!
customer_reviews.author: KARL H. DE SIMONE

customer_reviews.title: Just remember to check the list to make sure everything is in it.
customer_reviews.text: Only bad thing I have to say is that the whistles were missing and the med kit is paltry. I replaced it with my own.
customer_reviews.author: RMo

customer_reviews.title: Downgraded items
customer_reviews.text: Not whats in video. Downgraded the filtration straw and the food packets. Still a good kit but not worth the money now.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, small first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Great survival kit with products of great quality. Only first aid kit inside this backpack is kinda disappointing - it’s very small and contains mainly band aids of different sizes. All other items are great. Backpack is not heavy. And you have some room for extra items - I added radio, essential clothing, prescription glasses and some cash.
customer_reviews.author: Kallitoa

customer_reviews.title: Reason Why Comfort 2 Bag Felt Light: Missing 2 items
customer_reviews.text: 1) First Aid kit 2) the bowls I always look forward to opening up a first aid kit, and filling it with what I find helpful. So it was pretty disappointing not finding the kit. Also, the bowls weren't included. Any way these items can be sent to me? One of the zipper pulls came off and I wasn't even pulling that hard, but it's an easy fix. Otherwise it looks like the bag was prepped with care. It really should've been double checked though, so that whatever was paid for was actually inside.
customer_reviews.author: Austen 3000

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 72 Hour Pack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 72-hour pack. The pack and its contents are of above average quality and the kit is a perfect base to build on, and customize for individual needs. Fixed blade knife is high quality and well made. Water filter kits are also excellent quality and appear to be same manufacturer as life straw. LED lantern is well is innovative and easy to use; simply pull up and it turns on. Note for photos: All items located below pack in photo came with kit. Items to the right were added separately.
customer_reviews.author: MB, Pleasanton CA

customer_reviews.title: Good survival pack
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product is of good quality. The bag is made from durable material, and has enough room for more supplies. The food is good quality. And the supplies are all good quality. This item missed 5 stars because the water (both containers) had holes in them and leaked in the bottom of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: hcnuprekcus71

customer_reviews.title: Non-durable packaging for water the most Important item in your backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Water packaging is not durable. When I opened the box and pulled out the backpack, the water had broken and leaked all over and everything was covered in mold.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia moore

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, but...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this product. The emergency water is contained in 2 waxed-cardboard "boxes," one of which had leaked. The water got into the main compartment of the backpack, and also had wicked over into the adjacent compartment as well. In addition, there were 3 items missing from the contents list. So, unfortunately, this did not work out for us.
customer_reviews.author: Patty at the Beach

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Must have for any bug out bag/ emergency kit. I bought this for my girlfriend and I as a starter kit. And we added things along the way. It has your basics. And it would be comfortable and able to survive. We added things like more weapons, compass, paracord, biodegradable soap, solar radio with phone charger, tent, sleeping bag. That was our preference but to grab and go this bag is fully equip and totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Stuff missing--NOT
customer_reviews.text: I originally posted that a lot of stuff was missing and wrote a negative review based on that. However, I went to the website and after a very responsive chat session with someone there, they explained where the hidden pocket was that I had missed. All the missing stuff was in there. This looks really good. Everything here and of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Prud'homme

customer_reviews.title: Zipper isn't great
customer_reviews.text: Biggest issue is the zipper on the main compartment was already not staying shut, and after opening it up and rearranging things, the zipper was still pulling itself apart. Either it's overstuffed (doesn't seem like it) or it's a low quality zipper. Not something I want to worry about in a disaster but too late now I guess. Would have been nice to know there were no batteries for the flashlight and latern included...and what type I needed so I could order them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: All you need!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack comes with everything that you need for an emergency situation in a survival aspect. All elements inside are high quality. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Stavros

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love all the products provided in this survival pack. Just one problem...it’s really big and too heavy. My husband and I are in our 60’s and feel like we need to split the contents into two backpacks so we can carry them. Overall this is a great buy and happy we have it.
customer_reviews.author: June Carter

customer_reviews.title: You have to be careful.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, I would buy from this seller again. The product appears to be new and unused which was exactly what I ordered. I say that because I ordered a bag from another seller the same day. You can tell the difference. I am sending the other bag back. I will definitely keep this one. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better for the price
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get the 4 whistles. The lantern and flashlights are battery powered. Overpriced for sure. Not the worst kit though, the items that are there are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff in this TO GO BAG
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff in this TO GO BAG. Like it so much told the whole family to buy one just like it. Thnx
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bollinger

customer_reviews.title: GREAT; but basic simple supplies.
customer_reviews.text: Good volume of supplies yet definitely add addition needs. Stove is nice but received INCORECT pan support cross-members that were incorrectly cut to fit. Ask company to remedy this deficientcy!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great bug out bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. When you need to get out quick this is the third item you need to grab after your family and pets/weapons. Well stocked for any emergency. Just add a windup radio and your golden.
customer_reviews.author: Williame22

customer_reviews.title: Need to add items
customer_reviews.text: Needs some kind of heat source for cooking, matches , batteries, radio.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, but came damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to open it to get an idea of what was in this and it was wet! The emergency drinking water pouch was punctured and everything was soaking wet!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Hall

customer_reviews.title: A Lot for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. He just moved to California from New York and wanted him to be prepared in the case of an earthquake. Excellent Quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Femiano

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Need to add a flashlight and minor medications. It’s a little lacking compared to similar priced bags.
customer_reviews.author: Vern

customer_reviews.title: Survival Pack
customer_reviews.text: Love this complete survival pack. Sturdy, durable and completely loaded with supplies I did make a small pack with the supplies for my car. Be prepared! The best investment!!
customer_reviews.author: HVC

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Backpack - Best I've Seen
customer_reviews.text: This is the bag you want to buy. It could save your life in an emergency. There are lots of cheap imitators...this isn't one. Consider this a must buy for any house or vehicle
customer_reviews.author: HMW

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. Great starter kit. I added the following to the kit. RZ mask, sky radio, 8x10 tarp, 38oz Nalgene bottle, 2- 3mil 55 trash bags, and a Buck Knife full tang. Subtracted 1 of the bottles of water. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy pack. Most everything you’ll need except clothing
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty durable and almost complete however my pack lacked the flashlight. Pack is very heavy due to the water packs.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: We've been searching for a product like this and none of them end up being what ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been searching for a product like this and none of them end up being what we were looking for, FINALLY we've found what we need to feel like we are prepared! So glad we came across this and we are very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lambert383

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to risk of flood in my area. It seems to have everything one could need in emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Morin

customer_reviews.title: The perfect go bag
customer_reviews.text: The perfect go bag. It has all the survival basics you need with room to add more things.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: A must have good quality for the price and came as described but must add any Id meds Change of clothes personal items will be heavy
customer_reviews.author: Meme

customer_reviews.title: Survival backpack
customer_reviews.text: Got this one for a Christmas gift for daughter and son-in-law. Wow, were they excited with all that was in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amaesingme

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Two for the water container s are leaking in side of pack was soaked from them
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great to be prepared
customer_reviews.text: Some of the contents is kind of cheaply made. But great to have none the less. I can see everything working during an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far good. Items, quality for price is satisfactory However, haven't had the need to use yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought for car in case of emergency gives me peace of mind to have if needed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: 2 person survival kit
customer_reviews.text: It has an adequate number of necessary supplies. I feel the need to supliment with a few other items to make it complete.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Bell

customer_reviews.title: Water everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and one of the water containers was broken open so everything was soaking wet.
customer_reviews.author: Jax Spenser

customer_reviews.title: I really feel comfortably prepared. Who needs money?
customer_reviews.text: OMG....everything advertised is in the backpack, with enough extra space for more pertinent things, i.e. batteries, trail mix, vodka and red velvet cake.
customer_reviews.author: BUTCH BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kit
customer_reviews.text: Its nice,everything is accounted for but very expensive but overall good kit.
customer_reviews.author: Ayana

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded my package and happy with the products!
customer_reviews.text: The entire order is extremely high-quality and gives me great peace of mind knowing that this part of my preparations is complete. To my astonishment, they actually upgraded my pack to the premium version that has a color of backpack that i like better and the backpack has more space! Would recommend this product and company
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could add more things into the kit
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product but still missing important things in the emergency bag
customer_reviews.author: hls2100@email.vccs.edu

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great Great buy. This bag has been amazing for my lifestyle. If you are an adventure seeker, traveler, outdoors person etc then this bag is for you. Will buy/restock soon.
customer_reviews.author: Marshae Bennett

customer_reviews.title: excellent set do not forget to add you prescription drugs and batteries
customer_reviews.text: excellent set and excellent customer service for amazon. To complete your set do not forget to add you prescription drugs to the first aid kit and batteries for the flashlights and the lanterns. I am not big fan of mac and cheese so I added two MRE's just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Teodor Sotirov

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: It came with everything described, though at first I thought the whistles were missing, turns out it was in a pocket that I missed, so make sure you explore that bag well. Great backpack, I've even added more to it. Brings peace of mind knowing knowing I can be prepared for the worse.
customer_reviews.author: Linabel Pina

customer_reviews.title: Box of Water SOAKED !
customer_reviews.text: The unit is as advertised, but the water comes in 4 juicy boxes inside another box.. This boxed was soaked and the juicy boxes seemed punctured. At least a couple are not full.
customer_reviews.author: daniel norfleat

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it has everything you will need in a emergency
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it has everything you will need in a emergency. I did read some other reviews and added what they suggested. Sterno Cans, Batteries, Matches.
customer_reviews.author: CLR

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey but comes with a little bit of everything you need.
customer_reviews.author: H town

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Everything in this kit is low quality. The flashlight was broken when it arrived. I am disappointed in this collection of survival items.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best one on amazon
customer_reviews.text: Love this kit. Has everything we need and food is good for 30 Years! Bought 3 for my kids and family too.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lover

customer_reviews.title: Versatility, comfort, adaptablity and sustainabilty
customer_reviews.text: I have this product for hurricane preparedness. You can easily add shelter, light, power (solar) products and additional hygeine without significant additional cost or weight. This sits, without obstruction, in the back seat of my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Don’t buy this pack.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. The bag came frayed. The knife was not sheathed when I was pulling out the supplies. The sheath was in a different compartment in the pack, and it didn’t even fit the knife. The shelf stable water carton was crushed. Very cheaply made. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

product_meta.title: Premium Family Emergency Survival Bag/Kit – Be Equipped with 72 Hours of Disaster Preparedness Supplies for 4 People
product_meta.description: Size:Comfort4When disasters happen, the first 72 hours afterward are often the most harrowing, stressful and dangerous. Sustain Supply Co.’s Premium Family Emergency Go Bag for 4 people lets you take a set-it-and-forget-it attitude to emergency preparedness. You’ll save yourself time and money in searching for just the right high-quality items, too – just purchase one emergency go bag! The emergency survival kit includes all premium supplies, including: 1 large premium backpack, 24 Mountain House food servings, 48 Packets of Datrex water, 4 Sustain Supply water straws, 8 Cyalume SnapLights, 1 LED lantern, 1 fully stocked First Aid Kit, 4 emergency blankets, 2 bath wipes, 1 portable stove, 4 bowls and utensils, 1 MoraKniv knife, 1 Ferrocerium rod, 2 InstaFire tinder, and 2 whistles. In this 4-person survival kit you’ll find 6 liters of water for drinking and cooking and a Sawyer Squeeze water filtration system to ensure clean drinking water. 24 Mountain House Food Servings, enough to sustain 4 adults for 72 hours, are included in the family emergency survival bag. A Ferrocerium rod that requires no fuel and 4 InstaFire tinder which can be used as tinder when no other fire sources are available. One LED lantern offers ambient light for a room at night and 8 SnapLights give you general illumination with no batteries or open flames. Basic first aid supplies are included in this disaster preparedness kit as well as 4 emergency blankets that keep body heat in to optimize warmth and dryness. Every item included in our premium emergency survival kit are superior quality. After a devastating disaster, your family is already sacrificing so much – don’t settle for subpar emergency supplies. With Sustain Supply Co., you can be sure you’re equipped with the most durable and effective tools and the best freeze-dried food and hydration options out there. We’re committed to keeping your family safe and healthy in the aftermath of a tornado, hurricane, earthquake or other major disastrous event.
feature_bullets: 72-HOUR SUSTAINABILITY FOR FOUR PEOPLE - With this premium family emergency bag, you’ll have all the supplies needed for 72 hours of survivial for four people, including 4 Sustain Survival water straws, a portable stove, food and more.

SUPERIOR QUALITY SUPPLIES - All of the items provided in your basic emergency bug-out bag (BOB) are premium. All items included, from 48 Datrex waters to 1 fully stocked First Aid Kit, are top-of-the-line quality, giving you peace of mind.

ALL YOU NEED IN ONE PLACE - With this emergency go kit, you’ll have peace of mind. Save yourself hours of searching for individual products and money from purchasing them seperately with one bag that’s ready to go.

BASIC FIRST AID - After an emergency, health care providers may not be able to reach you for some time. Be prepared to administer minor first aid with the first aid kit with a variety of basic supplies and guide in this basic emergency survival bag.

LIGHT SOURCE OPTIONS - With this family emergency survival bag, you’ll have multiple light sources, a fire-starting device and tinder. Kit includes: a Ferrocerium rod, SnapLights and an LED lantern to help illuminate the night.
